Question: So recently I have been thinking about infinity, and one of the things that I thought of was if you were able to get a defined value for the reciprocal of a transfinite (cardinal) number. So, I plugged $\frac{1}{א_0}$ into WolframAlpha and it said the following: img1 Why is this the case? Shouldn't this be similar to this case? $$\lim_{x\to\infty} \frac{1}{x} =0$$ Aren't $\infty$ and $א_0$ equal to the same value in this context? What am I missing here?
Title: Why is 1 divided by aleph null undefined?
